Reviews.Title: “Tired Rooms-Good Service”
Reviews.Author: morristhecatchitown
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed and held a meeting at the JW Marriott in Dubai. You expect JW's to be high-end and well-kept but that was not the case in terms of the hotel rooms. The room are very tired and in need of updating, but they are adequate if you are not expecting the usual JW experience. I personally would not stay at this hotel again (and pay the rate I paid), unless the rooms are rennovated. Also held a 2-day corporate meeting and the service in banquets was outstanding. The food was good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding*****”
Reviews.Author: UnKlEBigJoe
Reviews.Content: We took a holiday in Dubai and found JW Marriott under the per diem rate. What a treat, incredible room, huge bed, bathroom very spacious. We really needed the down time and this was defintely one of my favorite spots. JW Steakhouse on the lower lobby floor was great, best steak I have ever had and my grandfather was a butcher. Breakfast upstairs was awsome the next morning as well. Food from around the world and the omelet station was intense. Thumbs up for this stay

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Spirit2006
Reviews.Content: Just spent a couple of nights at this property in Dubai. Good location, pretty quiet during the weekend. Easy to get a taxi to where ever you want to go. Not far from the airport, but if you are into the malls, then you have a bit of travelling. Lovely rooms, great service, very quiet. Only disappointment was being unable to eat in the Bamboo Village - didn't make a reservation, and wasn't expecting it to be so busy! Will definitely stay again at this location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with huge varity of resturants”
Reviews.Author: Aisha A
Reviews.Content: the hotel located in a very busy area at the middle of Dubai there is so many shops , supermarket malls around it plus the metro station is not so far it is with in 15 minute walking . the great thing in this hotel is the resturants . I dont know how many resturant there but there is alot and all what i try was perfect there is dutch resturant serve food from germany . also you can find tasty italian food and international and oriantal food . we booked the amiri suit which is the best one and the biggest . the room is realy big it is huge with 2 toilit and big seating area and bed room + dinning table for 10 people . the toilit has a jacuzzi . in general the room was great .

Reviews.Title: “Expected More”
Reviews.Author: Evolvingmonkey
Reviews.Content: Unassuming outside with a well decorated interior, a polite and friendly staff, spacious rooms, descent restaurants but lacks in room dining quality which could take a few lessons from their new sister chain Ritz-Carlton. The rooms decently appointed yet slightly dated and the staff was very responsive. The hotel seemed to have everything one would need which was helpful given its location. I don’t believe this establishment warrants another visit but enjoyed the stay.

Reviews.Title: “one stop for practically everything”
Reviews.Author: D S
Reviews.Content: Dubai has been my 'grand central' for all trips to/through the Middle East. As such, I have stayed numerous times at J.W. Marriott, which is located a short ride from the Dubai International Airport. If you get charged over/more than 50 UAE durhams (local currency), you've been jipped... the ride is anywhere between 30 & 50 durhams... depending on the time of travel due to Dubai traffic. Once you arrive to J.W. Marriott, you'd think you're entering a palace, and not a hotel. The foyer is grand, as is this hotel... you'll find plenty of entertainment; whether you're in Dubai for pleasure or business, this hotel will accomodate your needs. Gym, pool, spa, restaurants (in-house), coffee shops,... and if you're into some shopping, you have two immediate options: one is the adjacent local shopping mall, or as the other option is the shopping mall literally across the street from Marriott. Obviously, being in Dubai, you'd expect luxury et all... well, this hotel is at the high end, and may certainly have you feel like a king/queen for the duration of your stay. Staff is pretty helpful; although at times, you'd definitely have to struggle a bit due to language barrier; even though all of the staff is english speaking, english is not their first language and most of them are not fluent; so, there ya have it... For some, this may be a bit pricey hotel,... and especially since you do not get the full spectrum of services; e.g. you have to pay for the internet connection??? Seriously??? At this day and age??? C'mon Marriott,... for the amount of money you make a day, you can certainly afford to add internet connection as a complimentary service for all of your guests. Regarding Dubai itself, well... there's people that love it, and there's people that hate it... I am with the latter group... I have never liked it, do not, and will never like it... it is bottom line heartless, soulless, artificial whatever you might wanna call it... city, hmmm... I don't think so. But, never you mind all of that; back to J.W. Marriott: the rooms are comfortable; very spacious, with a huge flat screen tv, and a large bathroom... bed is great... you will get your rest,... your "five minutes" of peace and quiet,... Bottom line, I recommend this hotel for all people passing through Dubai, and not wanting to stay at the horrible-terrible airport hotel... Service is very good; Value is so-so; Sleep quality is excellent; Cleanliness is excellent; location is very good, as are the rooms... Hope this helped, and safe & happy travels...

Reviews.Title: “Only Downside is Location”
Reviews.Author: LongIslandRuss
Reviews.Content: Service is great, rooms are great, very large, nice bathrooms. Beds are great. If you are in Dubai, and want to explore you need to take a cab everywhere. Metro is close, but most JW Marriot guests, are probably not Metro users. Close to the airport. I got a very good rate with the conference I was attending. They charge too much for internet, and it doesn't work well in the conference room areas.

Reviews.Title: “Dated but still worthwhile staying”
Reviews.Author: Brydon_n
Reviews.Content: In need of a revamp compared to the multitude of new gucci hotels in Dubai. The JW steakhouse is still the best in Dubai without doubt. The service is impeccable and mr casmiro the star of them all. Well done

Reviews.Title: “JWM Dubai - Authentic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brown Bear T
Reviews.Content: Hi Travellers. Me and my Lords spent 5 nights in this hotel in December 2009. The only weakness is very bad district location of this hotel. Food was delicious. We had the halfboard and I can recommend it. On The Christmas Day was the special christmas party with buffet, gifts and music. The hotel has special inside space covered with glass roof, so it is calm and with moderate temperature. Moreover, in this "internal courtyard" is several sestaurants and bars and place for thematic events like Christmas or New Year`s Eve. There are small simulation of tropical forest and park in the hotel. It is good place to spend several days with family or friends in Dubai. Airport is close, so the transfer is quick and cheap. We enjoyed the stay there very much. Regards. Brown Bear Traveller

Reviews.Title: “Not Marriott standard. In urgent need of re-furbishment.”
Reviews.Author: 123gz
Reviews.Content: Very old fashioned. Room layout strange- lving room between bedroom and bathroom! Rooms smell old and musty. Chair and sofa upholstery stained. Very poor sound proffing. Noise of lifts in room, but room not near lifts.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, good service, run-down interior”
Reviews.Author: MarkManama
Reviews.Content: Through an offer from the Marriott Vacation club we stayed for 3 days/2 nights at the JW Marriott. We arrived around 11am and the lady at reception was very helpful and managed to get us an early check-in. Generally service in this hotel was very good, with friendly and helpful staff. The room we stayed in (2 beds as that was the only non-smoking room available for an early check-in) was very spacious, with a separate seating area and an view at planes flying into Dubai airport (no noise). 2 large HD TVs with a wide variety of channels, good shower and a comfortable sofa. Our general impression of the hotel was that it needs a renovation or at least replacement of furniture in rooms, reception, outlets etc. It's an old hotel and you can tell. We had dinner in the Bamboo Lagoon which served a buffer with various Asian dishes. The food was ok, not fantastic. There was a 'Valentines package' on offer at the healthclub which included a 60min full-body massage, 30 min facial and 30% discount in any restaurant in the hotel for AED 350 in total. Worth doing if you decide to stay in for an evening. Overall we enjoyed our stay, but mainly because we had a good deal via the Marriott Vacations Club. I wouldn't find this hotel good value if we had to pay the full price. As a last point, wifi is only available for ridiculous prices (as in most Marriotts) throughout the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “North Tour and Marriott spoiled my stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Sunil P
Reviews.Content: It was my second visit to Dubai in two months. JW Marriott being a trusted name world wide and I holding a membership in it, opted it for my family stay but to my utter surprise, the 5 star hotel cares the least for those guests who arrive here by group bookings. My bookings were made through North Tours, Dubai and the day I arrived in Dubai i.e 27th Jan 12, they started cheating us. The immigration and Retina scan process took 2-3 hrs and even when they had been informed for a late pick up from airport, North Tours just turn their back shedding away from responsibility. Even the hotel didnt care to check about our late arrivals. The room booked through North Tour was sub standard and inspite of shedding a heavy amount I was denied of the basic Tea-Coffee maker facility in the deluxe room. The room was in a bad shape with unattractive interiors and maintenance demanding bathrooms. While I was not happy with the room stay, on the other hand North Tour made it worse by their indifferent and arrogant attitude. The drivers just give a call on their way to the guest and if the phone remains unanswered for any reason, they just leave the guest unpicked on the pretext of Guest not shown up, while they actually do not wait in the hotel lobby. My desert safari trip was ruined by these people. The representative from North Tours Mr Chandra Singh Rathore states blankly" Either you feel Good or bad about it, we cant help". Since the booking was made through North Tour, Marriott doesnt even care to investigate the problems and cater to the needs of the guest. I am terribly upset with both the North Tour and hotel. I strongly recommend please dictate the terms and conditions before booking such international holidays especially with family so as to avoid an unhappy situation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: emonya
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in, the staff could not do enough to make us feel at home and comfortable. Even thoug the property is old, it is wounderfully maintained. Our room was very large with a sitting area and a very spacious bathroom. House keeping kept the room well stocked and took down the covers in the evening leaving us chocolate. Room service did not want to take a tip for their efforts. They were quick and always very respectful. This hotel has the best Consierge staff that we have ever encountered. The gym facilities and staff were excellent and very helpful. The hotel is well located and easily accessable by inexpensive taxis or the great train service. The only negative was the high cost of internet service which we were told was complementary prior to check in when we were told of the high cost ($130 for 6 days).

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel , Bad Place”
Reviews.Author: Mohamed b
Reviews.Content: good hotel , we had a very successful meeting and the food was excellent but hotel has very small swimming pool very bad location , noisy and ugly room view

Reviews.Title: “hookers?”
Reviews.Author: jadedexpat
Reviews.Content: this used to be a great hotel, but during my last visit i noticed the distinctively unwanted presence of prostitutes. Dubai is such a den of vice and this was one of the few places where your were not bothered by these awful chinese. Management please fire your security because there are hookers working the beat in your bars. On of the hookers even has has a lazy eye!

Reviews.Title: “Family stay in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Shawnnz
Reviews.Content: I have stayed there with my family for three days. This is the second time there. Always crowded with tourists and locals. Great location, just 10 to 15 minutes to air terminals. and 20 to 30 minutes to main shopping malls by taxi. the room was good enough and nice. The staff are friendly. Recommend to stay there when you are in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Dubai!!”
Reviews.Author: ThomasfromDamascus
Reviews.Content: When ever one stays in Dubai it is always a 'touch-and-go' situation as they vary quite a bit especially on the upper end hotels!! No problem in choosing the JW Marriott Hotel in Deira District of Dubai. Great location, just minutes away from all three air terminals!! Great Hotel both in room selections and service...we stayed for nine nights between the Holidays. The room we had was very large and it was simply an ungraded Standard Room!! Had all the necessities any five star hotel needs for a great nights sleep. One of the best beds in the "Hotel World"...very, very comfortable!! The service is tops as everyone that greets you is always giving you a greeting!! The various restaurants all the servers are tops... Hotel Training...this is where this hotel excels...I found out each new waiter must go through a 6 month training program!! This is unheard of but the results do pay off...Really top service... The Doom in the main hotel area is a marvel...really nice with running water below it and many, many trees and flowers. A must is the Piano Lounge located below the dome...live music, of course piano music!! Must stay while in Dubai, as the taxi charges are very reasonable to all parts of the city!! Thomas L. Webber

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need some TLC”
Reviews.Author: MontanaPilot
Reviews.Content: The Marriott is very convenient for those wanting proximity to the airport, not so much for people visiting to experience the city. You will be spending a bit on taxi's if you want to visit the city every day. The airport is just minutes away though. The lobby and overall first impression of the hotel is exactly what you would expect in Dubai. Incredible decor and a very unique atrium with a piano, bar, restaurant, and even a little river running through it. The executive suites are worth the extra money (i think my room was $30 more) because it grants you access to the lounge (free wifi, food, drinks) and a car to/from the airport. The room itself was actually a little bit of a surprise after seeing the lavish entrance. I guess that's where they used up all of their money. The service however was incredible. Concierge, front desk, doorman, and even the handymen around the hotel were all extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms are in need of a renovation. Old carpet, uncomfortable old furniture, a decent bed, and a plain bathroom. Overall I would probably not go back there just because I know Dubai is a hotbed of lavish hotels and for the price, I'm sure there are much better options out there.

Reviews.Title: “great service and breakfast - but a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: mikel58
Reviews.Content: very close to the airport - great for what I needed, but quite a way out of the main life of Dubai the large room made the long stay manageable superb breakfast and buffet lunch

Reviews.Title: “Good restaurants, Bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: faisalf
Reviews.Content: This hotel is big and the atrium with its glass ceiling looks stunning. The rooms are old and need renovation immediately. Breakfast is amazing, there is so much variety, I dont remember the name of the place where they serve breakfast but the decor is like an old arabic indoor market (souk) with wooden barrels and earthen pots. Some two dozen varieties of fresh fruit, about 10 types of milk and 20 types of cereal along with all kinds of eggs and cold/ hot meats it is endless. The JW steakhouse serves some of the best food in Dubai, like some others have already pointed out, for a tourist it is not close to anything. Like everywhere in Dubai, Indians and Asians get third class treatment and that applies at this hotel as well. I stayed about a week and experienced multiple instances of staff being super nice to the Arabic speaking guests and European/ American tourists and staff's outright rude behavior to Indians who make the mistake of staying there.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: gibagante
Reviews.Content: I liked the cleanliness and that there were a lot of shopping malls inside the hotel and a lot of restaurants.....that was not a hotel....that was a city!!

Reviews.Title: “Safe choice, good service”
Reviews.Author: GPeto
Reviews.Content: Location wise this property is clearly not in a super place, but there are 2 advantages. 1. Its close to the aiport,2.the metro is 4 minutes walk from the hotel. (trust me and use the gold class on the metro) This is a big big hotel. Its a big favorite of airline crews because of its location. Rooms are big. A bit too old for my taste. But it certainly brings you the outdated Marriott standard. Breakfast is good and restaurants in general are good in the hotel. I would not stay here for more then 2 nights if I am a tourist. The area where the hotel is located is crap. There is nothing to do or see here. Internet is very slow. Gym is SUPER. Service in general is good. Although finding somebody who will actually be able to assist you with a question will not be that easy as the hotel employs way to many unskileed workers from neighboring countries....and Im not being racist. Just saying.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place!”
Reviews.Author: JDTravels30
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a very nice hote. Service is EXCELLENT!! Everyone from the bellboys, the front desk staff, everyone was overly helpful! Can't say enough about that. I have stayed at this property a number of times, and they never disappoint. Rooms are nice. Classic, "old money" feel with nice marble and solid doors, etc. Breakfast in the exec louge is a pretty nice spread, and included for exec suites. (as is free wi-fi in the lounge). The only issue I have with the hotel is that Internet rates in the room are overpriced. It should be included these days.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location But Not a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Aaron_Adkins
Reviews.Content: I used to live in Dubai, and we would go to this hotel for its great restaurants. Having moved from Dubai and going back on a business trip, I chose to stay here. I have never had a bad experience with a JW Marriott. They have always been top quality. This hotel is of this top quality. The restaurants are great. The Executive Lounge is good. The service is good. My Executive room was very large. With our corporate rate, the hotel is a great value. My only complaint is that this hotel is located in Deira. This is no longer the happening part of Dubai and is a bit congested. The gym is just ok. If location is not critical to you, this is a good hotel. If location is important, stay at one of Dubai's many other fine hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Hotel , it's old but i like it”
Reviews.Author: mBahareth
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is So Classic and comfortable i like it , the breakfast is not up to my standards but never the less the functions that the hotel has i quite impressive , it's old but like it .

Reviews.Title: “Not a JW property”
Reviews.Author: Potakas
Reviews.Content: Overall the experience was very pleasant and their concierge desk is very good and helpful. There was a misunderstanding on my check out as I had originally booked (from www.marriott.com) a breakfast included rate and they couldn't see that. They tried to charge me for the breakfast but everything was sorted out when I handed them the original e-mail from Marriott. Their car service (BMW 7 Series), both for airport and rides in the town is excellent (above Europe's standards) but the property is no a JW one (JW properties should be more luxurious), I would regard it as an ordinary one.

Reviews.Title: “High standards but a bit worn”
Reviews.Author: morsva
Reviews.Content: A very friendly hotel. It's very big and you find all you need. It has a cozy pool at the roof, a big gym and several restaurants. The breakfast is well filled and very good. The rooms I've stayed in has been big with a big bathroom. Well cleaned but not really up to date for my taste. I have only stayed here when working and it works perfectly for this and I think it would fit for leasure as well. The area isn't the funniest but shopping and restaurants are only a short walk away. To get to the beach, take a cab (they are cheap and the meter does not run when the car stand still in peak traffic).

Reviews.Title: “suite really suits you”
Reviews.Author: mathur_amit1975
Reviews.Content: stayed there for 4 nights. staying in a JW Marriots was as good as it should be.Rooms are very spacious ,neat,comfortable with all the amenities. Washrooms are of good size and very luxorious. Rooftop swimming pool is very good and Gym is excellent. central restaurant is big with a live piano performance. Best part is a small wooden restaurant.Banquet hall is big enough for the gathering of 500 persons comfortably.

Reviews.Title: “Our experience while in the executive suite”
Reviews.Author: MTravel84
Reviews.Content: This was not the first time that we have stayed in the hotel however previously we have always stayed in "standard" rooms. During this trip we were in the executive suite for two nights. The room was very spacious, clean, and comfortable. While we enjoyed the stay... there must have been some remodeling in another room perhaps upstairs as we heard hammering until around 8:30pm/9:00 pm. Another area that was a little bit of a letdown was when we arrive back in the hotel after going into town. We (my sister and I) were approached by one of the employees in the lobby of the hotel and were asked if we were staying in the hotel (which is fine to ask) and had to confirm this by stating our room number. This was then preceded by him walking behind us and following us down the hallway until my sister turned around and looked at him. Now while I understand there is a need for security, these sorts of questions should therefore be applied to everyone and this was not the case as there were others guests who walked in front of us and were not questioned. Thank you for the stay, we did enjoy the trip for the most part despite the little issues mentioned above.

Reviews.Title: “Solid stay”
Reviews.Author: Rivonia
Reviews.Content: I had a conference at this hotel and stayed for 1 night. The rooms were a decent size, very clean and the bathroom was really spacious. I would recommend the steak restaurant, the food was lovely. The pool area is nice for a quick dip. The conference venue was good.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, could be better”
Reviews.Author: jayjo_11
Reviews.Content: I like the Marriott brand and I have stayed in other hotels, but this seems to be the worst of all. The rooms need updating and the internet is too expensive for the speed. It is in Deira, so it should not be considered a tourist hotel, but it could be revamped. Other than that, good service, spacious rooms. The shower door did not close fully. It was annoying since the bathroom floor was wet. Full size bath tub and I had a nice view of the airport :) I've had the best steak in a long time at the Italian restaurant. Very juicy and soft.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Business Hotel in "Old" Dubai”
Reviews.Author: DavisEM
Reviews.Content: This Marriott was perfect for a Business hotel and good location if you are in Deira area. Clean, spacious rooms, nice restaurants with great food (and not expensive) as well as good spa facilities. Lovely morning breakfast fit for a hungry traveler getting ready for a busy day. Service was excellent. I was not in Dubai for Business, so the location was not ideal as we had to take taxi rides across Dubai Creek constantly into "New Dubai" to get to the newest mega malls, Ski Dubai, Burj Al Arab, the Beaches, the Palm Island, etc. I would suggest the Dubai Harbour Marriott for a such a location.

Reviews.Title: “Everything is in great shape”
Reviews.Author: lib88
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business in October 2011 and read many of the reviews before booking. The only complaint that was accurate was the Internet. It does cost about $30 to get connected, unless you have access to the Executive (Concierges) Lounge. The wireless is free there. The speed is pretty slow, but I think that is just as much because the users as Marriott's lack of speed in their networks. I had a hard time adjusting to the time change and spent many hours on the Internet around 3:00 in the morning and the speed was much better. The rooms are nice, clean, upgraded furniture, and huge bathrooms. I had two rooms during my stay. The first was a King bed in the older part of the hotel. The walls are thinner, but the furniture was the same as the second room. They upgraded me to a double bed suite after my first night, probably because they wanted the King bed. If you understand you are not staying near the tourist attractions, this is a great location. Close to the airport ($35 AED one way by taxi) and in a quiet neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “More of a stopover hotel”
Reviews.Author: laxmigoddess12
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay in a Club Level room. The first was a year ago and the service seems to have suffered in that timeframe. Upon arriving was told that there was no room upgrade available, (have guaranteed upgrade status), and was given a room far, far away from the Executive Club Lounge. This wasn't a problem, but no working internet was. No WiFi as of yet in rooms and wired connection did not work. Changed rooms and surprise, within that 30 min time frame a Club room had become available. Room Service food is fine and delivered within 30 min. Housekeeping service is spotty. Glasses not replaced, towels not replaced at evening turndown. Watch that you aren't charged for mini-bar charges from the previous guest. When you check-in make sure that items aren't missing from the in-room snack and bar service. Free internet for club rooms, otherwise the internet charges are expensive. Fitness Center is average. Pool is located on the rooftop and is nice. Flight path from airport gives you a good look at the underbellies of aircraft taking off in the near distance. Service at pool is good and friendly. Service in Executive Club for the most part is not up to par to other JW's. No one asked to take breakfast egg order and almost everyday had to search for someone to take our order. Best service came from a trainee named Jessica who was there on an externship from The Netherlands. Atmosphere is very loud. Not so much due to guests, (though the acoustics are poor and the room gets loud), but due to the fact that the staff makes a lot of noise banging dishes, clinking glasses, etc. when they set up and take down at breakfast and cocktail times. It is hard to hold a meeting with the noise and then they vacuum and clean the room during business hours. Couldn't this be done when the lounge is closed? This seems to be more of a stopover hotel than a true business hotel and if you are planning on using the Exec Lounge for business there are better options in Dubai. If you're just stopping over to break up a trip you probably will have no issues.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FreeTheDragon
Reviews.Content: I stay at the JW Marriott several times a year. Many of the staff remember me by name, they are very helpful and the rooms are always clean, elegant and more than adequate. I've been upgraded several times without even requesting it. The location is central to many sites and the JW Steakhouse has some of the best steak in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tinkerbell_edi
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff, great breakfast and very nice rooms!!! The only negative I believe is that there is no wireless internet service and the wired one is unbelievably expensive!

Reviews.Title: “reception staff is incompetent”
Reviews.Author: Andrey7778
Reviews.Content: When I checked in they blocked some amount on my credit card but when I checked out they charged due amount not from that blocked sum but from rest credit card amount. As result I had one charged and one blocked sum. I stayed there for long time and blocked amount was high for me. So I asked could they unblock the blocked amount because my bank would keep this amount blocked for 30 days. They agreed but instead of release this block they made charge and refund of blocked amount. These two transactions resulted into my lost of approx. 120 USA dollars because sell/buy exchange rate is different. Now I am trying to cancel these transactions with my bank, hope I will succeed.

Reviews.Title: “Dump, certainly not worth the JW in its name”
Reviews.Author: Halawala
Reviews.Content: I used to stay in this hotel around the 90's and it used to be our home away from home. After 10 years since my last stay, I decided to relive the past. I wish I didn't... The hotel itself hasn't changed. I asked to be put in a "bigger" room, and the rooms certainly wasn't big in size. The furniture is reminiscent of a 4 star hotel and most the room is just plain! The AC on the 6th floor wasn't working; the gypsum ceiling was dripping with humidity and smelled like urine. The wallpaper was already showing its age, as well as the toilets which hasn't been touched in at least 15 years. I think this hotel needs an urgent revamp. Even though I was a single traveller, my voucher says breakfast for two. The manager refused to give me a free breakfast for 2 and instead wanted me to pay for one more--even though it says 2 on my voucher purchased through marriott.com!! The manager was certainly rude and impolite. I showed him my email and it clearly said breakfast for 2. He claims thats it wrong. HOW COULD IT BE WRONG AND IT CAME FROM THE MARRIOTT.COM WEBSITE? I certainly would not stay here every again. Thank God my nightmare ended for just one day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but ..”
Reviews.Author: BoHashem
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel during the past 20 years, I like everything except the extremely high rate of the Internet service, which is about €2 for 30 minutes

Reviews.Title: “JW Marriott - Nice but below expectations”
Reviews.Author: HamzahKray
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel close to the airport, if you experienced a long flight to Dubai and not interested to get stuck in Dubai traffic, then this hotel is a good one for you. Arrived around 4:00 pm and the room was not ready; requested a non-smoking room but they gave me a smoking one, when I asked for non-smoking; they gave me one. Had to wait around 45 minutes until me room is ready The room is spacious but average, not the best furniture but will do just fine, I was happy with it simply because the hotel is close to my business meeting. I would not repeat my visit to this hotel unless I have business to do close to the hotel, otherwise; the hotel is not on my visit again list. Morning newspaper is at your room door every morning. Room service is on time and the hotel breakfast was great. One night I asked for food delivery from outside the hotel, it was great that the hotel received the order at the reception desk, paid for the order and then delivered it to my room with no complains from anyone, I would have expected that this is not allowed.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: BillM1964
Reviews.Content: This is a dreadful hotel in an undesirable location and desperately in need of a renovation. The first thing that amazed me after checking in was there is no WIFI available in the rooms. Is this Dubai in 2011? A note in the room, rather amusingly, advises you that you can used the cabled internet service and make international telephone calls at the same time. Whoa! Not surprisingly the cable didn't fit into my smartphone. The bathroom was very dated - no walk-in shower, which for me is a no-no. Room service - needed because it was Ramadan and most of the hotel restaurants were not available before 8pm - was dreadful. One request for ice took more than an hour, which meant we could not have the intended pre-dinner drinks in the room. The next night we decided to order wine to avoid the ice debacle, but this also didn't arrive in the 45 minutes we allowed for a pre-dinner drink. Staff are in need of training - big time. The breakfast - again perhaps because it was Ramadan - was served in the Italian restaurant - and was the worst and most limited buffet I can recollect in any 4 or 5 star hotel ever. We dined in the JW Steakhouse one evening, which was excellent. So if you fancy a steak, stay somewhere else and just use this restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel located close to airport and old city”
Reviews.Author: joycekwong
Reviews.Content: Stayed there a few nights on business - the hotel is located close to the airport and old city, quite different to the resort hotels near the beach on the other side of town, or the newer hotels in the new city center. But Dubai is relatively easy and cheap to get around by taxi and there are no traffic jams.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Resort, Very expensive”
Reviews.Author: beachlvr1
Reviews.Content: Process started with my calling Global Reservations and booking the place. When I talked I was promised breakfast, lunch, dinner and free internet access in the rate. When I got the email for reservation confirmation, it only had breakfast included. When I called Marriott both the hotel and global reservations, they said they cannot offer the package. This was very disappointing. Stayed here for 6 nights. Package had breakfast buffet included. Breakfast buffet was awesome. Food is very expensive. Internet access is extremely expensive. Paid 500AED ($140) for a week. Daily and hourly rates are very high. No wifi in the hotel unless you go to the business center. Requested for upgrade - was not given (although I have over 200K Marriott points). Amazing thing is that there was a scheduled power outage for over 4 hours during the day. This is ridiculous. Scheduled Internet outage was also there twice during this stay. For a 5 star hotel this is not acceptable. Pool is ok on the roof. Overall the staff is very helpful with the exception of the Reception desk. Will probably not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Un organised Chaos”
Reviews.Author: roycalvin
Reviews.Content: Having come off a long day in India and then and evening flight from Mumbai to Dubai I was looking forward getting to the Hotel and getting some sleep, however this was going to prove a long way off. Despite having a confirmed pre paid reservation I arrived at the hotel to find that the lobby was in chaos and angry guests everywhere shouting at staff. When I got to the check in desk I was told like a lot of others that there were no rooms available! After 20 minutes it was decided that I needed to go and wait in the coffee shop until they could try and get a room organised. After an hour I returned to reception and, after another 10 minutes of arguing I managed to get a room key. When I got to the room it turned out that the room had not been cleaned and so it was back to square one again. After another 15 mins I did get a key to another room to find the electrics being repaired, which I managed to get sorted out. After two hours of effort by 11.30pm I could eventually say I managed to occupy my room and start to look forward to getting some sleep! I will not be staying at the JW Marriott again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hremtulla
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in most 5 Stars hotels in the world, and specially the view I have for JW Mariott is of a high expectation, specially after spending several stays in JW Mumbai India. I came for a day on my way to Singapore, and took a break. The hotel is old, needs a management training, specially something to with customer care. For Dubai Standard, this hotel is very low standard. And from the world point of view, this hotel should be a 4 Star hotel. Very basic, had to wait for 2 hours before getting my room despite of my request of early check in 2 weeks ago, which I was told should not be a problem. The hotel is worn down, even the bed sheet are not of JW but just of Marriott. It is located in a very strange area of Dubai which I had never visited. I was suppose to stay back on my return but I have now changed my plans. Their breakfast is basic, the staff are in the air, while talking would be eating dates and spitting seeds... come on, some profesionalism needs to be there...

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for an overnight DXB layover”
Reviews.Author: triwinner
Reviews.Content: Because it is right by the airport, I would not stay here for a Dubai holiday. For that, stay on the beach. However, for an overnight airport layover, this is a great choice. For several years, I always stayed at the Renaissance – they lost their Marriott franchise last year and I had to find a new location. Taxi fare from the airport here is less than $7 US. Bell staff and reception was very efficient and friendly, with a mainly Filipino staff. The lobby area is large and beautiful. Room was very clean and well equipped. Bars and restaurants are equivalent to any JW Marriott that I have stayed at in other parts of the world. There is a Hofbräuhaus beer hall on the premises – it is very tiny compared to one in Germany or Las Vegas (these are only other ones that I’ve been to). I did not use the spa, gym, or pool and I cannot make a judgment on these.

Reviews.Title: “Well, sometimes they are good and sometimes they are horrid, especially if you are a woman alone”
Reviews.Author: suspect309
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice. The location sort of sucks, (airplanes taking off all the time right near the hotel and it is in a weird section of town) but cabs are cheap and it is easy to get one. The hotel has management issues: I had some issues I thought the GM should be aware of, but although I spend over 100 nights a year in Marriott Hotels, and I twice requested a manager to call me, no one followed through. Rather disappointing. The hotel had a great buffet on Friday, and the concierge lounge is LOADED with loud American businessmen who can not wait to share the conversations with the whole lounge....aside from all of that, the issue is if you are a woman travelling alone, don;t bother with this hotel as it will not provide any level of service close to 3 starts, let alone 4 or 5. Shameful, but true. the room was clean, fresh and although part of the carpet had been replaced with another pattern (death by bleedout?) it was just OK

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff! great hotel”
Reviews.Author: littleswisstravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a couple of days on a convention and i have to say that everything has been flawless...the rooms are large, the staff is wonderful! Smiling, and genuinely caring for their guests! Will definitely return to this property if i have the chance to go back to Dubai! If you go there, make sure you pass by the rooftop terrace...absolutely stunning!

Reviews.Title: “Typically business hotel, with average service!!!”
Reviews.Author: wingsLV
Reviews.Content: We were 4 days in JW Marriott Dubai hotel. I must tell that i was dissapointed about the service.I got the executive level, but nothing executive you won't find( only the lounge). That property is typically business hotel, nothing for relaxing! The stuff doing only what they have to do-without the "extra mile" and "extra smile". Small old pool,but good fitness facilities. Situated very central ( in Deira).Walking distance to metro appr.20 minutes. If you stay one night is fine, but not more!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelingFamily7778
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business, and the rooms were very spacious with two flat screen tvs, spacious bathrooms; however standard decoration doesn't seem to be newly renovated at this time; a little dated compared to other JW Marriott's I have stayed at. Rooftop Swimming Pool was nice, and spacious gym. Plus the restuarants were delicious - went to them all except the Steak house. No WIFI available was my biggest complaint in the guest rooms. There was a LAN I could pay pay for almost US $25 a night. WIFI available in lobby by purchasing a WIFI card to use for minutes. It was highly annoying to travel with my IPAD, and not be able to connect in my room...especially as this is an international business hotel. If they had WIFI in guest room, even for a charge, I would happily have rated this hotel 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious comfort in the middle of the desert”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter3474
Reviews.Content: Had a great business + pleasure stay experience at Marriott, Dubai. Excellent staff, business centre, Ball room as well as fitness centre. Restaurents are clean and service jis impeccable with near perfect Indian food. Among the city attactions, particularly enjoyed the sightseeing around Dubai with Desert safari and Snow skiing at Emirates Mall. Also got the business done smoothly as ever...

Reviews.Title: “Good 5-star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: emjay911
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I booked in a 5-star Hotel in Dubai and I can tell is was good. I know there are better hotels. It was a special package offered for an Executive Room for 3 days that cost AED 2000, with free breakfast everday in the Executive lounge that had free Wi-Fi and a 7-series BMW from and to the airport. Check-in and check-out was friendly and smooth. Rooms were good, tidy and clean. Good room service.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not 5 star quality”
Reviews.Author: indianfamilyof4
Reviews.Content: We spend 7 nights in Dubai with 5 nights close to the newer part of Dubai and thought we'd end the stay with 2 nights in a 5 star However JW Dubai is definitely among the lower rung 5 stars in Dubai as well as within the JW chain itself With its location in Deira, its anyways far from the newer attractions of Dubai, so not the best location as well

Reviews.Title: “avoid”
Reviews.Author: sylvain7
Reviews.Content: You want to avoid this hotel. The location is poor, in the middle of a business district, no view, no water, no park, no nothing. The halll is OK, but the rest is the 1980ies all over again. The rooms look as if they have not been redone since the '80ies, with old fat TV's, noisy AC, a bathroom that is from a horror movie. And my room was dirty: I found two long hairs in my shower (on on the wall!!). I can go on but won't. I cannot find a single reason why anyone would want to select this hotel for a stay in Dubai, work or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel, can handle large groups, conventions”
Reviews.Author: DGLION
Reviews.Content: We had gone to to attend a Conference of Lions from 56 countries from ISAAME (India, South Asia, Africa and Middle East) This hotel is excellent on all counts: can handle very large groups of guests, conference facilities are world class, food variety, quantity, quality, presentation - all are value for money."Delighted " is the experience everyone had.

Reviews.Title: “jw marroit is great hotel location not bad.”
Reviews.Author: kashif92
Reviews.Content: i stayed with my friends for 5days in this hotel.The hotel look is great but just a little bit old look beacause this is old dubai but its not bad most of shoping on sites.food was great and lots choice, The hotel is located very close to the airport, and has a rooftop swimming pool, which allows you to take a peak every now and then and see planes land and depart at DXB. The pool area is really great for a young and they have child pool.Realy we did lot enjoy and we used all hotel faciltys.the hotel is locted old dubai that the reson shoping is quiet cheap and food out side is chaep.i recomend this hotel very much

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant hotel in a bad location”
Reviews.Author: bbb1987
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW Marriott using Marriott Reward points for 4 nights at the beginning of February. The hotel is located very close to the airport, and has a rooftop swimming pool, which allows you to take a peak every now and then and see planes land and depart at DXB. The pool area is really great for a hotel that is located in the older part of Dubai. There are at least 10 restaurants within the building, and there is the Bamboo Lagoon that offers dinner buffets and live music every evening. It is a very popular place even for the locals, my personal favorite was the lobster that is grilled to your liking by in-house chefs. The property is a JW Marriott, so the rooms are slightly larger than at other Marriott properties, though slightly outdated. They are very cosy nevertheless. The hotel made a good impression on me and is perfect if you're looking for a hotel close to the airport. Otherwise you might want to consider other locations.

Reviews.Title: “A great escape from everything”
Reviews.Author: emeyg
Reviews.Content: I and my husband spent a very lovely weekend at JW Marriott Hotel Dubai. We were envited by Marriott Vacation Club to attend a 90 minute show about their timeshare business. We flied there and spent a wonderful time in Dubai and enjoyed the romantic Dubai winter season. The hotel is elegant in Deira area. It is a bit far from the new areas such as Sheikh Zaid Road and Jumeirah, but that wasn't what we were looking for. A romantic weekend was our aim and we enjoyed it to the max. The design of the hotel, the room, the breakfast buffet were all awasome....

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maccke
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff. Good value. The restaurant on the lower floor offer the best steaks in Dubai..

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in the centre of nowhere”
Reviews.Author: globusat
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott is, like many other hotels of international brands in Dubai, a perfectly organized, well maintained and very plush looking place to stay. Unfortunatly its location is somewhat in the middle of nowhere but considering the moderate taxi rates it is not that much of a disadvantage! However be very careful of the room floor you get upon check-in as there are many rooms in floor 2 without a view; and this is meant literally - the windows (or even the balconies) are shaded black!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but not a hot spot”
Reviews.Author: traveler60305
Reviews.Content: JW Marriotts are rarely poor experiences and the JW in Dubai didn't disappoint. The staff were all excellent and extremely capable to communicate with in english. The food was very good, the sports bar in the basement had reasonably priced drinks and the concierge did a fantastic job. My only concern was the location. It is not located in the more exciting area of the city however transportation is cheap and the train station is located nearby. I had no problems going to and from the attractions or the other side of the city. The workout facility is top-notch and the pool staff was excellent. I plan to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel. There are far better properties for the price”
Reviews.Author: balajivk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for a night before I decided to switch to the Crowne Plaza. This is one of the older properties in Dubai (refurbished a few years back). While the bed is very comfortable, the TV and furniture are very old. Also the cost of internet access is at least twice that of any other properties in town. The property is located in the older part of town and is far from any of the newer malls. The location is well served by taxis and hence transportation is not a problem. The staff are pretty helpful and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “The best bed ever!”
Reviews.Author: Bertie33
Reviews.Content: This is vintage Marriott; elegant and plush surroundings and excellently appointed room, even if it appears dated next to the space-age competitors that have been sprouting up all over the emirates. As I was on a business trip, I was in one of the executive rooms, which had a jaccuzi, walk-in shower, separate dressing area and one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. The business lounge offers free wi-fi as well as 24-hour snacks and drinks. The sports facilities (pool and gym) are good, and the hotel has several restaurants, all of which I have tried and offer good fare (my favourite was Cucina). naturally, this doesn't come cheap, but then you get what you pay for. Perhaps the only minus point is that some of the reception staff were not as effective as they might have been. I

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended for families with small children.”
Reviews.Author: Cpt_Insano
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the JW Marriott for a total of 10 days, me being both on business for 3 days and sighseeing the rest of the time. In fact we didn't do as much sightseeing as you would think since they have great restaurants right in the hotel, the Cucina being reasonably priced with great food. All alcoholic drinks are expensive 225 AED for a bottle of wine, but I guess thats normal for muslim countries. The staff were great all the way from check in to check out, including the bar staff, concierge, roomservice and poolstaff. We even borrowed a kind of childrens chair from the Cucina restaurant to use in the taxis since our son needs a child seat. Everyone was really nice to us and especially our son, talking to him, smiling and interacting with him, that is what we will remember most. The hotel has a very nice pool which has the air traffic buzzing close by so if you like to do some airplane spotting this is the place for you. It is expensive but very nice and clean, the internet is extra which is a shame and the tv's are outdated. But the rooms are nice and the beds are fantastic! I recommend to stay above level 3 since the weekend "nightlife" in the bars below is audible from the inside of the room on level 2. Not too much, but enough to be slightly annoying. Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, and just so/so”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller550
Reviews.Content: I started out not liking this JW, and came around the longer I stayed there. Typical palace of a JW, large entry way, huge common areas, enough marble, granite, and gold plated fixtures to make you think you are a sheik. On the other hand, the staff is rather stiff and inflexible, the hotel is out of the way and dated by Dubai standards, and everything costs money (try $15 an hour for internet and $50 for the buffet, and $20 for a drink). Stay here if you are a gold or platinum, and if you need to be close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Dated but good for using Marriot Reward Points”
Reviews.Author: CF25
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights at the end of September. The Hotel is a bit dated but rooms and public areas are spacious. My parther is a Marriott Gold card member, which meant that we were given a room upgrade and access to the executive lounge, which was excellent. Check-in and out was very efficient. Prices for food and drink in the hotel were quite high but not any more than other five star hotels. We ate in JW's steakhouse, the Bamboo Lagoon and Cucina. All were good but JW's in particular was excellent. The pool area was quite small but as most of the other guests appeared to be on business we had the faclity almost to ourselves. I am sure there are better places to be had in Dubai but for using up your points for a relaxing break it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel and Close to Airport”
Reviews.Author: swmarie513
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for one night with award points. I was actually able to modify the reservation without a problem two days before I left. I had a late flight and wanted something close to the airport. Upon arrival I was told I had been upgraded to a suite, which was very nice. The suite was very clean and there was a lot of space. The lobby personnel were friendly and helpful upon arrival and departure. I did not try any of the restaurants in the hotel. I did use the fitness center which was a little outdated but had all the standard equipment I would expect. The location is okay, definitely didn't walk to anything within the area. Expect to pay around $10 to $15 USD for a one way taxi ride to the city center/touristy area.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your dirhams”
Reviews.Author: Travelguy365
Reviews.Content: Stayed a total of 3 nights at the JW Marriott Dubai for business to and from the U.S. The hotel has a great luxury feel, especially in the lobby and dining areas. The rooms were a bit dated but had a comfortable feel to them. I was upgraded on the outgoing portion of my travel (one night) to an executive suite and that was appreciated. Larger than the standard rooms and with a nice view of the courtyard. One the incoming portion (two evenings) I had my standard room. The bed was extremely comfortable with, I believe, a goose down comforter. The breakfast buffet was excellent as it should be for $30. (Yes, 100 dirhams for the breakfast buffet!). This was a pre-arranged voucher for my travel and at $190 per night (with breakfast) it seemed that free internet would be included especially for a business voucher/trip. No, that is another $30 per night! Overall, a very nice place to stay and has the large feel of a luxury hotel. One pays for it though with the "added" features. This is a very typical Dubai maneuver. If for a room, internet and dinner at $300 per night is your cup of tea, then this might be for you. If part of your business goals is to save money or to spend it wisely, then just bypass Dubai all together for business or any type of activity.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for using points”
Reviews.Author: Qflyer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with wife and 2 year old son for a couple of nights on points. The rooms are a little dated - could do with cleaning the carpet and generally "modernizing". The Executive Lounge though is awesome - love the full breakfast (made-to-order eggs, meats, etc.) - lots of great variety. I'd stay here again - but not sure if i'd want to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “oh your colleague, she is a gold member”
Reviews.Author: J-A-N-I-S_1981
Reviews.Content: I was traveling to New Zealand and decided to fly with Emirates and so stopped off in Dubai on my way back to the UK. Luckily for me my wonderful friend decided to join me. I arrived a day early and booked for one night, requesting that my booking be tied to my friends booking for the next 5 nights. I checked in hours before the official check-in time but luckily for me my friend, who travels a lot with work, is a gold member and so we were instantly upgraded to a suite and given access to the executive lounge! The staff could not have been anymore helpful at checkin, I was personally escorted to the lift by the gentleman who checked me in. The suite was HUGE although I was disappointed the TV was not flat screen and that internet was only free in the exec lounge. When my friend arrived they were expecting her and greeted her by name, the attention to detail here was second to none and I highly recommend this hotel for those who wish to enjoy the luxury of Dubai without having to deal with those brits who think they are swish and chose to holiday at Atlantis, although they cannot be escaped if you wish to dine in Nobu.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but appaling check-in”
Reviews.Author: ilockyer
Reviews.Content: We arrived here at 0130 am 11/7/10 after a long flight with 2 young and tired children. The male receptionist was unfriendly and didn't seem to be able to smile. The check in process was extremely slow, though I now know this was time wasting as there was no room available, even though we had paid for the room from 2pm!! We were then made to wait for another 40 minutes while the room was made up. The receptionist also tried to sell us an upgrade much to my annoyance. A very annoying and unsatifactory check-in. Couldn't fault the actual hotel or food though.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast here makes Hong Kong look like McDonalds!”
Reviews.Author: pekopper
Reviews.Content: The food served is fantastic. Beds are clean, room comfortable, probably the best hotel I''ve ever stayed in. Good location, good shopping, close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Bravo JW”
Reviews.Author: madhukrishnan_9
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the JW for 5 nights Airport Reception- Very efficient, was met,greeted and offered refreshments late night. The entire episode was smooth and we were whisked away in a BMW . The executive Lounge- The largest rooms i have stayed in any hotel of its class! Really really large, the decor is a bit early 2000 but very well maintained and gives the room a very distinguished feel. The housekeeping is Excellent and do a terrific job... BF at the lounge- Very friendly and you could walk across any time of day or night to have soft drinks, cofee ect. The breakfast could do with some variety especially if you are staying for more than two days. The walk around Buffet- Must try but get to dinner early as the buffet shuts at 1130, you can try the buffet and live cooking from three restaurants, Must Must have the grilled fish at Market place at the live counter. Keep plenty of time to move between restaurants. On the whole a lovely experience. Did encounter a few 'working girls" in the bar and around the lobby, but what the hell, everbody needs to make a living...I strongly recommend this hotel for travellers who like the feel of a traditional fivestar ...not the glitzy ones with gizmos and spot lights on your head ai the Loo. Thanks JW for making this a memorable trip... will return again and again!

Reviews.Title: “expensive”
Reviews.Author: sanjoy
Reviews.Content: stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in june. i stayed in their double room. the room was large and the beds were big though a bit too soft for my liking. the bathroom was big with separate shower and bathtub area. minibar , safe deposit box , steam iron etc were all available. but internet wasn't free. forget about the wifi, for just plain and simple internet the charges were exhorbitant. breakfast was good and they varied it daily. other meals were OK

Reviews.Title: “Very impressive set up in heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: krishnak
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks small from outside hiding away, but once you go inside it is huge and the layout is excellent and you can a very comfortable stay in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great get away from home”
Reviews.Author: radsdhams
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel. It not only stays up to its name and reputation but delivers even more. I visited the hotel with my wife last November. We intended to stay for 2 night but because of the hospitality we decided to stay 2 more nights and enjoy Dubai better. One classic example of our good experience with the hotel was we are jains so we consume no non-veg food and one day we were out until midnight. Certainly hotel restaurants are not gonna serve everything at the time we returned but they prepared a complete meal made of vegetarain dishes. I have not had this kind of experience anwyhere else. Thought I have put up at alot of other hotels in Dubai which includes (The Address, Hyatt and Le Meredian) we do look up to the hospitality we were given at JW Marriot. From now on we have made up of staying at any of the Marriott properties to any destination we travel. Thanks. Dharmesh

Reviews.Title: “Amazing from start to end”
Reviews.Author: sami6857
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing experience, from start to end. I had an executive room, a friend of mine had the deluxe room, and they are almost exactly the same, but I had a view for the great indoor courtyard and I had access to the executive club. The room was spacious and very clean and its cleaned twice daily. The bathroom had a bathtub and a shower place, and it was very clean. The bed, oh that bed must be the most comfortable bed at all. The staff was very nice and welcoming starting from the door man to everyone I passed by, they were all smiling and welcoming and trying to answer your requests They have a huge indoor courtyard which was an amazing place, it was very bright with lots of greenery, it had a coffee shop, and two restaurants. This place is just one of the most amazing sites you can find in a hotel. There are many restaurants, Italian, a steak house, another one called market place, some Chinese and Japanese restaurant and lots of coffee places. The hotel is attached to a mall, it had some restaurants and a supermarket which was very convenient. The only thing I didn't like about the hotel was the breakfast, it had the smallest selection options I ever seen, I mean 3 star hotel might have a better selection than what they had, it was not at all worth the price but as I was in a business trip, my company had already included the that in my room price. Some of the reviews here made me very worried about staying in this hotel. The prices in the restaurants were very normal compared to other 5 star hotels in dubai and they were totally worth it. And the hotel doesn't seem outdated at all, there's not a single place where you could say is old or outdated. In conclusion, this was an amazing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “VEry good overall......shame on you for the pricing”
Reviews.Author: FrankMarton
Reviews.Content: A very good overall experience with lovely layout, good rooms and friendly service. A few shops on the ground floor plus a starbucks (if you’re into that) and plenty of good restaurants. Lots of concierge services, tour booking possibility and Marriott Club sales as well. The Italian restaurant was ESPECIALLY good and the service there was top notch. Only negative was that there was a conference in town (like when is this not true in Dubai) and the management chose to jack up the prices using this as a feeble excuse. I mean REALLY jack them up to ridiculous levels knowing that many of the other local hotels were booked solid. Not a good way to reward loyal customers and I would expect more mature behavior from a kindergartner.

Reviews.Title: “First-class hotel, but whatever your rate is, they sting you on everything else”
Reviews.Author: Gobbledyspook
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel but is let down by some things that you might just expect to be better for a flagship hotel in the Marriott chain. I was here waiting for a few days waiting for a flight home during the volcanic ash thing. Hadn't been to Dubai in a couple of years, and always used to stay at the Intercontinental at the Creek. On the face of it, this place was up to that standard, but realised it wasn't quite. Rooms are lovely. The one I had was huge, very nicely furnished/decorated, and had everything I could need. However, I was on the Exec Floor due to Marriott frequent stay card. However, I expect the rooms are in general pretty good. The hotel is built around a huge indoor courtyard which is quite a sight. You can sit in there and have a coffee/snack/meeting, and it has a huge glass domed roof which really makes you feel like you're outdoors without the heat/breeze. Very impressive, and looks great fromt the lifts which look onto it a you go up to your room. There are many restaurants at the hotel itself - about a dozen - but be warned, quality varies enormously and all are VERY pricey. In fact, my impression is this place lures you in with rates comparable to similar hotels (not extortionate, to be fair, for the type and quality of hotel) but then really stings you for all the extras. I mean REALLY stings you - how about £20 ($30) a **day** for internet! Yes, $30 a day. This is a constant gripe in nearly all my hotel reviews: paying for internet access at all; how come hotels charge us for this essentially fixed-cost item? Answer: because they can. Why don't they charge extra for running water and lighting? One day this will seem as unacceptable as smoking on planes. Anyway, back to those restaurants. All are in very nice surroundings. A couple of them are really good - JW's steak house and the Lebanese restaurant especially. The former is superb, but particularly extortionate though. Really expensive. Like $150 for my meal - a beer, a main course steak with potatoes and veg, and a singe glass of wine. On my own. However, the Market Place restauruant was particulalry disappointing. It only has (very high-priced) all-inclusive all-you-can-eat-and-drink packages, but the food choice is not what it could be at the price (starting at about £50 ($75) a head). In fact, the food isn't very good at all. The Intercontinental on the Creek is attached to a mall complex where there is another restaurtant on the same theme (choose your raw ingredints like in a market and get them cooked in front of you) also called - no coincidence, I'm sure - the Market Place, which is much, much better than this one. And I don't believe it was anywhere near as expensive. That one is highly recommended if still there. My theory is that all the restaurants in this JW are so expensive because the location of the hotel (unless you need to be near the airport, and it's not even really that near) is not good at all. It's not near anything, and certainly not in any of the hotspots of Dubai. There's no view of anything from anywhere. You can easily and cheaply get about in cabs in Dubai, but I suspect the hotel relies on people on business not venturing out and choosing to eat in, and charging accordingly. Heallth club is very good. Service in general if you need anything is VERY fast and efficient. Rooftop pool is small and disappointing for a hotel of this size.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible JW Marriott, Dubai!”
Reviews.Author: Florida56
Reviews.Content: It was our sixth time in the JW Marriott and it was like"coming home" . The services were very professional as well as personal . We were given a marvellous room and loved all the cushions on the bed. We used the pool several times and enjoyed the fitness centre. One of the highlights in the hotel was a dinner in the "Steakhouse" and a lovely evening at the "Blue Lagoon". There are many more restaurants and even a real Hofbrauhaus! The pianobar is in the center of the hotel, overlooking the townsquare, in the evening very romantic with all the candles.every fridaynight there is aTango-evening, by the way, famous in town. The JW is an older hotel, decorated with wood and marble and a lot of atmosphere. It is close to the airport, but yet close to the souks and shoppingmalls. In anyway a hotel to recommend!! Karen and Klaus

Reviews.Title: “Excellent city and the hotel”
Reviews.Author: TTTTChina
Reviews.Content: In Feb 2010, we spent 6 days holiday in Dubai and stayed in the JW Marriott Hotel Dubai. This is the first time for us to be in middle east. The hotel is close to the airport and to the "old" city, but quite convenient to reach beach, Palms, shopping malls...... The room of the JW Marriott Dubai is larger than most 5 star hotels. The breakfirst is fantastic. It has a lot choices, from western to local style. The staffs of this hotel are very nice and efficient. For example, they helped to organize the desert safari which went very smoothly. It was really a good trip and I believe we did a good choice to stay in JW Marriott in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “JW Marriott - a great place to stay, a superb place to rest”
Reviews.Author: Turgai
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Marriott hotel was very pleasant (stayed with my wife and our 2-year old). Excellent service, nice rooms, great restaurants and facilities and, most of all - fantastic JW Marriott beddings you will not want to get out of, which in combination with soothing quietness of this hotel at night quickly restores your energies to highest levels. Good stuff we tried in this hotel: JW Steakhouse Restaurant - excellent NY steak experience Fitness center - wide variety and good service Rooftop Pool with Bar - warm and comfy. Few things to be improved: old TVs, pick-up service was late.

Reviews.Title: “5 star service in 5 star legendary JW Marriot”
Reviews.Author: Tihi33
Reviews.Content: It's hard to pick a great choice within the range of world class hotels in this city. However, JW Marriot is in my heart, due to the truly classy atmosphere and suberb service, and the location. If visiting for business and leisure, it is one of the best choices. Not for sun and beach of course, but apart of beautiful rooms and JW Marriot excellent staff, the hotel has 3 great restaurants, out which one of the best Italian restaurants in Dubai. It is relaxing and at the same time posh. Breakfast superb and most importantly, warm feeling of home at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but Nice”
Reviews.Author: Radarman123
Reviews.Content: Despite price -- it i one of the best in Dubai. Especially if you stay on the concierge floor. Great restaurants -- especially JW's, Cochina. It is a good hotel to stay during Ramadan as they will have one good restaurant open throughout the day.

Reviews.Title: “A Bit Disapointing”
Reviews.Author: MaggieCGlasgow
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a few Marriott hotels & always found the standard to be fairly high but found the JW Marriott in Dubai to be a bit average & disapointing. The lobby is quite impressive but the room we were given, was small, dull & dated. Although I had requested a non-smoking room, they didn't have any left when we arrived & so we settled for a smoking room as the receptionist assured us that it wouldn't smell. It did! As we were only there for 2 nights & were out most of the time we decided to put up with it. The area were the hotel is located (Deira) seemed a bit run down & dirty when compared to other areas in Dubai. On a positive note, breakfast was great & plentiful. Our stay at the JW Marriott was just okay & when you consider the room rates, I think you can do better for the same money or cheaper. We stayed at The BurJuman Arjaan hotel for 5 nights prior to our stay at the Marriott & found it to be fresh & modern with much larger rooms in a nicer area & overall much better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional JW”
Reviews.Author: Anne_WDC
Reviews.Content: I stay here whenever I pass through Dubai for work. I am not a fan of the city and as this hotel is by the airport it is my kind of place. I stay on the executive floor and receive a private check-in and access to the lounge, which provides a plentiful breakfast, free internet access, and snacks and drinks throughout the day. The room is large, a bit outdated, but very comfortable nonetheless. The hotel boasts several restaurants, a spa, a roof-top pool and a great gym. I highly recommend the gym's head trainer Danny. After observing me workout, he offered me free training sessions during my stay, for a chance to kick my butt and he definitely did. What a nice perk! Will be returning for more :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not Marriott standard”
Reviews.Author: Origami101
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotels twice (end od December and beginning of January) for over-night as we had a flight to Bangkok and back home next morning. First time the hotel was not very busy and we got upgraded to a better room where we had free internet and it was spacious that's why we decided to go with it again on the way back. But unfortunately we had a different experience. As the other reviews mention, the hotel is aged, needs refurbishment. The breakfast was good but the restaurant itself looked not up to Marriott standard. Before our flight we needed to use internet for 5 minutes to check something online but there is no free internet availble, the cheapest one we found was 15 Dhm for 15 mins in the business center. The reason we chose this hotel was its being next to the airport and it was about 10 mins drive. Next time we will be in Dubai we will stay elsewhere, did not enjoy our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Potentially a good hotel, but sadly not recommended”
Reviews.Author: LondonGirl888
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the JW Marriott in Deira for 5 nights and were looking forward to a restful break - unfortunately we didnt get this. We were put in a room that overlooked the bar/restaurant area in the hotel, which meant that our room was exceptionally noisy. 40% of all the rooms look over the bars in the hotel, which means that you have a high chance of getting one of them. However, if you like poor quality, blaring, repetitive Frank Sinatra blasted into your room until after midnight - then this is the place for you! Another problem was the lack of beds by the rooftop pool. If you want to go on holiday to get a nice lie-in, then forget about this place. You have to be up by the pool by 9am every morning to be in with a chance of getting a bed for the day. Once people are up there, they tend to stay all day. Our 2 objectives for our trip were 1) to get lots of sleep and relaxation 2) to do lots of sunbathing. It was disappointing that this hotel was not ideal for either of these things.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Marriott we've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Midship
Reviews.Content: There are far better hotels in Dubai to stay at, dont stay here if you are expecting the same standards as other Marriots as its certainly not the same. We've stayed at a lot of Marriott hotels and hence why we booked this but we were very let down. It was very dated and the staff had a couldnt care less attitude. The pool area was horrible, difficult to even get a menu to order from and music was blaring and certainly not relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel: spacious well appointed rooms”
Reviews.Author: Hoods_Travels
Reviews.Content: My favourite hotel brand is Intercontinental as its usuallly the most consistent and provides a luxury feel. However, if my stays in JW Marriott are anything to go by then things might change! The two JW Marriott's I've used (Cairo and Dubai) have both been excellent. In Dubai I had an upgraded room on the executive floor and the room size was very good. The furnishings are comfortable and the whole ambiance is of a 5 star hotel. The bathroom was large with a separate walk in shower. Everything was very clean. The meeting rooms are very nice and overall the hotel is much better than is its sister hotel the Renaissance which is close by. I think if you're staying in this older area of Dubai, then the JW Marriott is the best option. It's only 10 mins from the airport so makes a great business venue. Reef Mall is just down the road and City Centre Mall is just 5 mins by taxi. Dubai Mall and Mall of the Emirates (the 2 mega malls in Dubai) are 20-30 mins taxi ride away as they are located in the newer part of Dubai. If you're interested in being closer to these mega malls or the beaches then I'd choose another hotel in the newer part of Dubai. However, that is not a reflection of anything wrong with the JW.My onyl gumble would be that the internet is chargable. So overall, a lovely 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, but needs refurbishmet, ok experience”
Reviews.Author: flamboyant624
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for about 4 nights, but were not very happy with the hotel. The hotel locaion is ok, no great views from the hotel as it is located in the business district, but has good access to shopping malls and main city center. Taxis are cheap and easily accessible from and to the hotel. the hotels is a little old establishment and hence the interiors are a bit dated. The ambience and furnishings looks tiring and some refurbishment will make it a great hotel. we booed the hotel from hotel's website and they said that the room would be a loft, but turned out to be a normal room, which was a disappointment because we paid extra for that and it was no different from a standard room. Moeover, they said that for the room we will be given an exclusive breakfast at their special area, but later we found out that their normal breakfast, that they offer to standard rooms, was much better and had a huge variety. Felt a bit cheated, paid extra for a superior rm, but nothing was superior except the money charged In fact the rooms had a strange smell, we asked them to change but even the other one had the same problem. Its about 30-40 min away from the Mall of Emirates and 20 min drive to the gold souk, however is close to burjuman shopping cente and the city center mall. Staff was ok, nothing great. Overall the experience was not so good as we expect froma 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not delightful”
Reviews.Author: Jonseagull
Reviews.Content: I was there to attend an event happening in the same event. the trip was dooned form the start since i lost my luggage leaving Dubai. Despite of an explicit request for an early check-in(not guaranteed, but I had been assured that there will be some available), there wasn't one available! i was told that i am second on the waiting list for check in and two rooms have just come up, but will take TWO hours cleaning up. Two Hours! this may be ok in normal course but not perhaps when the guests are waiting. I am sure they could have done better!! Other than this it was an uneventful stay without any incident - the hotel did not delight me, neither did it do anything awkward. The only other strange thing that i noticed was the Television in the room - it was an old round picture tube thing - one that i had noticed after a while in a hotel of that reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Old Dubai”
Reviews.Author: estate1
Reviews.Content: A good hotel but the location is not so nice. Hard to find and nothing to see from the hotel. But inside the hotel the facilities are good. Rare to find German restaurant is also there. The 24 hrs coffee shop is good and unlimited soft drinks etc are provided. Breakfast is good. Size of rooms are quite big. Good when you are going with kids. Don't go to Dubai during July-August, very hot and unbearable. Big shopping malls there to entertain. For short stay during Feb-March its OK.

Reviews.Title: “Good Marriott”
Reviews.Author: jknight910
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights at the JW Marriott Dubai. The hotel is excellent. We used points and were upgraded at no charge to an Executive Suite. Check in was fast, easy, and uneventful. All aspects of the hotel, from the fitness center to the ease of getting taxis, were outstanding. Hotel restaurants. We usually don’t eat in the hotels but on our first night, we were too tired to go out. There was an Italian restaurant which charged about $50 for spaghetti, lasagna, and a large bottled water. It included all you can eat bread, as well. So, that is how the prices fall. Executive Lounge. One of the better lounges. Similar in amenities as Cairo and Mumbai. Free WiFi, breakfast has eggs/omelets to order, fruit, cereal, the works. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice near airport”
Reviews.Author: alankk
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in early October and was perfectly happy. Room was spacious and very comfortable, w/more than ample AC. Pool small, but nice.
